definitions.definition: A seat across a boat on which a rower may sit .
examples: The fisherman sat on the aft thwart to row.

definitions.definition: A brace , perpendicular to the keel , that helps maintain the beam ( “ breadth ” ) of a marine vessel against external water pressure and that may serve to support the rail .
examples: A well-made dugout canoe rarely needs a thwart .

definitions.definition: An act of thwarting ; something which thwarts; a hindrance , an obstacle .

main_definition: ( nautical ) A seat across a boat on which a rower may sit .
secondary_definitions: ( nautical ) A brace , perpendicular to the keel , that helps maintain the beam ( “ breadth ” ) of a marine vessel against external water pressure and that may serve to support the rail .
( rare ) An act of thwarting ; something which thwarts; a hindrance , an obstacle .
